intro: Collinsia floribunda, commonly known as the California popcornflower, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and coastal dunes. It has slender, hairy stems and produces small, seed-like structures that resemble popcorn, giving it its common name. Collinsia floribunda is often found in disturbed soils and is adapted to thrive in dry, coastal environments.
